issues.description: The problem statement (Part 2) says “Each method takes a `Consumer<List<Note>>` parameter” for the PersonController methods, but both the template and the solution expect/declare `Consumer<List<Person>>`. This is a copy–paste / type typo in the problem text that can confuse students about the correct generic type they should use when implementing PersonController methods.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the problem statement text to refer to `Consumer<List<Person>>` (not `Consumer<List<Note>>`) when describing the PersonController method parameters. This ensures the description matches the template and solution method signatures and avoids confusion.
